responses: You contact student affairs at  0726550016. Or by email at studentaffairs@chukauni.ac.ke for more information, please visit the university web page.

patterns: what is the cost of a student card?

responses: Your first student card is issued for free. However, if you damage, lose or misplace your card, the cost of a replacement card is Ksh. 500.

patterns: how do I apply for an undergraduate course?

by what method can I apply for an undergraduate course?
can you tell me how to apply for an undergraduate course?
responses: Undergraduate applications to Chuka University are submitted using an online application form, which can be found on the University website. Before submitting your application, please  make sure that the details are correct and truthful. Any wrong doing will nullify the application.

where do I find the online application system guidance and help?
responses: The step-by-step instruction guide for online application to study at Chuka University is available on the University website: www.chukauni.ac.ke.
You can contact the admissions office on; phone: 0726550016 email: admissions@chukauni.ac.ke

patterns: which documents must accompany my application form?
on my application form which documents are required?
which documents are needed on my application form?
which documents must go with my application form?
when applying, what documents are needed for the application form?
responses: Please ensure that you comply with the minimum admission requirements before you complete your application form. Follow all the instructions carefully when you complete an application form to ensure that all requested information has been supplied and all the required documents have been attached. - enclose a copy of your identity document or your passport. - attach copies of your examination results and academic transcripts.

patterns: how do I change my programme?

responses: An application to change your programme must be done in writing or email before the closing date of the programme. One can send the email to academics@chukauni.ac.ke indicating which programme must be added or removed

patterns: how do I apply for residence?

just how do I apply for residence?

responses: all applications are done online. The university will issue a link to be used for application and the application must be done before the deadline. the student must also make payments as early as possible to secure the room

responses: You can visit the University website for information about bursaries and loans.
Undergraduate bursaries for students are awarded after application  based on merit and level of need. To apply for any Chukauni bursary  please visit the university website for more information.

Bursary information as well as an online application form is available on the MSU website at: www.chukauni.ac.ke. The online bursary application form is also active from November to january every year. the exact dates are ussually communicated using the Email from the Dean of students

patterns: how can I pay the application fee?
how much is the application fee
where can I pay the application fee?
responses: The application fee of KSH 2000 can be paid as follows: 1. On the online application system, you may pay the ksh 2000 application fee using your Mpesa paybil  and submit code of payment together with your online application form. 2. Application fees are not required for students with dissabilities.  NB: The application fee is non - refundable.

patterns: what is the history Chuka University
tell me the history of Chuka
responses: The University of Embu (UoEm) was established as a Constituent College of the University of Nairobi via a Legal Notice No. 65 of 17th June, 2011 by His Excellency the President. EUC is the successor of the former Embu Agricultural Staff Training (EAST) College which started in 1947 as an agricultural training school and was later renamed Embu Institute of Agriculture in 1968. In 1990, it was upgraded to be Embu Agricultural Staff Training (EAST) College whose mandate was to develop and implement short management and technical courses, and offer research and consultancy services to enhance performance in the agricultural sector.  This continued until June 2011 when the College was converted to Embu University College through a Legal Notice No. 65 of 17th June, 2011. The EUC council was inaugurated after its upgrading from Embu Agricultural Staff Training (EAST) College by President Mwai Kibaki. Friday, 7th October, 2016 became a historic day for Embu University College. This day marked the transition of the Institution from a Constituent College of UoN to a fully- fledged University. The University of Embu was formally awarded a Charter by H.E. President Uhuru Kenyatta at a colorful function held at State house, Nairobi.

Our programmes are market and demand-driven and in addition, teach key transferable skills and attributes to equip students with the tools they need to succeed in a highly competitive workplace. Our courses are flexible and have a wide choice of more than 40 postgraduates and 70 undergraduate programmes to choose from. Our courses are structured as bridges leading students to successful employment or further study. All our Schools have highly qualified and experienced staff that are committed to developing the skills and career aspirations of our students.

Chuka university has 6 Faculties. Namely: 

 1. School of Education & Social Sciences 
2. Faculty of Law 
3. School of Pure & Applied Sciences 
4. School of Nursing 5. School of Business & Economics 
6. School of Agriculture
